name: Mayflower Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the finest Inn's in all of the Northeast. I would highly suggest staying multiple nights as the property has so much to offer and more then one can handle in an evening.
reviews.title: The epitome of 5 Diamond 5 Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a perfect place for a romantic get away! My boyfriend and I visited in December for a weekend that was way too short. From the moment we stepped foot on property we were treated with excellent care and service. Every person we came across was kind and friendly. The room was divine, especially the bed, so comfortable I didn't want to leave. The food was absolutely delicious and the service in the restaurant was top notch. The spa, my favorite part of the trip, gave me much needed relaxation and rejuvination. The Mayflower Sweet Surrender was the best! I definitely suggest that one. All in all I would have to say this was one of the best vacations we've had. We can't wait to return!!
reviews.title: Wow!
Amazing Retreat!
reviews.text: Well it was the photos of the property, and the stories of the service that enticed my husband and I to pick the Mayflower for our 1st weekend away without our 14 month old. This was the perfect place for our romantic retreat. The grounds are breathtaking, and the rooms... well, lets just say that the baths are very luxurious! The decor in the rooms was amazing, and the staff kept us nicely kept! The beds were the most comfortable I have slept in while traveling and only complimented the finely furnished room, far exceeding our expectations. Our dining experiences were only just as great. The food was so fresh, with beautiful presenations and very delightlful to the taste. The spa was much needed, and I was delighted to find a most relaxing and tranquil, not to mention BEAUTIFUL, place to experience my rejuvenation. The staff, everywhere we went, was genuinely inviting and always welcomed, or greeted us as if we were guests in their very own homes. Although we hated to leave after such a short weekend, I am happy to say this will be our monthly retreat to unwind, relax and rejuvenate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend stay at the Mayflower Inn and our experience there was wonderful. Concerned about stuffy, uptight service, we were pleased when greeted by a cheerful and friendly reception.
reviews.title: Wonderul time at the Mayflower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well appointed with beautiful decor and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. When combined with room service, there was really no need to ever leave our accomodations. Of course, we eventually journeyed down the elevator, which opens up onto the main floor close to the dining room and bar.
reviews.title: excellence at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend. The room we had was nice and looked out on the gardens, but it felt a bit dated. The bed was wonderful - the gift shop actually carries all the linens and we bought the featherbed, etc, because we liked it so much (I was pregnant and it was next to impossible for me to find a comfortable way to sleep, so this was very helpful).
reviews.title: The good and the bad.

reviews.text: Small/Big issue - all the smells from the restaurant below permeated our room. As I was pregnant, it made me literally, immediately, sick every time I entered the room, so I could not stay there. For the benefit of regular people =) my husband said that it was pretty bad as well. The housekeeping service offered to air it out for us, and to "spray" the room, but given that I was pregnant I did not want any heavy spraying to be used and asked them not to spray the room. Airing out the room did not help, in fact it made it worse. We decided to leave for dinner and hoped it would be better. After dinner, it was not better, and they had actually sprayed the room while we were out (you could smell the spray in the air).
reviews.title: Excellent Retreat or Romantic Weekend .. but Pricey

reviews.text: As they were booked, they could not move us to a different room. They gave us a choice of staying in the Tea House ( I think that is the right name), which is kind of a game house separate from the inn - they moved the sofa and put a bed in there (not a great choice). Through all of this all the staff were extremely pleasant, and they tried to be helpful.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous........can't wait to go back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is only worth mentioning because of how bad it was. Both for breakfast and lunch the service was lukewarm, inexperienced and inadequate. The food barely passable, definitely not worth the prices. I would strongly recommend that you go elsewhere if you are staying at the Inn.
reviews.title: Not All It's Cracked Up to Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was fabulous. The prices were not low, but I felt the service and ambiance was great.
reviews.title: Litchfield hills retreat

reviews.text: My husband sent me and a friend to the Mayflower for a relaxing weekend. The Spa (which you can generally only use if you stay at the Inn) was everything I would have hoped for and more. It is gorgeous, relaxing, and professional. I can't rave about it enough. The Inn, on the other hand, was a little different for me. It is a typical high-class inn with antiques and art everywhere. But it feels very 'stuffy', and has a very rich, older crowd. It looks completely different from the meditative, simple spa. The chintz on the linens and window treatments was a bit too much for me. The rooms are super-comfortable (although the towels were scratchy, which I thought was strange), complete with soft linens, comfortable bed, flat screen TVs, fresh flowers,and a gas fireplace. My bathroom had a lovely tub, but the shower wasn't very attractive. It's definitely a top rated Inn for a reason, very comfortable with great service, but the decor and atmosphere was just not for me.
reviews.title: go for the SPA and comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Unfortunately, i did NOT like the food at all. I frequently dine in top NYC restaurants, so I am very picky about my food. I had high expectations, because of the feel and price of the Mayflower. But everything was just...bland. The plates looked fancy enough, perhaps too much so. Sauces had no flavor, and the food was definitely under-seasoned. My friend's fish was beyond overcooked. The crowd in the dining room didn't seem to mind though. But my friend and I were not pleased. We ordered a cheese course for dessert, and the cheeses arrived stone cold. a big no-no. the 'dried fruit' on the plate were simply raisins, and did not look appetizing. The waiter also did not know which cheese was which. I'd say go for the Spa, enjoy your comfortable room, and eat elsewhere.
reviews.title: Wonderfully welcoming

likes.liked: — Beautiful room with a wonderful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room and they up-graded me to a suite overlooking the Shakespeare Garden. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. The staff was very friendly, calling me by name from the first evening. The area around is very beautiful for a drive. The food and waitstaff are marvelous. Could not have been nicer, truly 5 star.
reviews.title: Lovely. Not 5 Star yet.. but not far to achieve.

likes.disliked: — The Disjointed feeling between the Spa & the Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband & I have stayed @ the Mayflower a few times now & We have always really enjoyed this place. The last time we were was approx 8 months ago. In my opinion, The Mayflower is very elegant & it’s service has also, mostly been very gracious & thoughtful. They have nice little details like a small quiet library to curl up in as well as a larger reading room w/complimentary computer usage, magazine’s, newspapers, games & coffee table books. Wellington Galoshes, Raincoats & umbrella’s sit by the cottage’s Main Door, just in case you need to borrow on a wet day while antiquing, etc.....
reviews.title: Relaxation deluxe
Reality exceeded the hype
reviews.text: The Main Restaurant is v. good but a little inconsistent. In our experience, some nights the food was outstanding & the next night it fell short (even the same dish). They have a young wait staff. Some of the wait staff have been there for years (sometimes coming off as a bit smug) & some were clearly too green & didn’t know exactly how to deal with the more exacting/demanding guests, who you can easily see, are extremely well-heeled.

reviews.title: Dinosaur Inn, Unprofessional Management/Ownership, Avoid at All Costs
reviews.text: The Mayflower Inn is a total sham. Do not waste your time and money. My fiance and I were planning for a May 2010 wedding and John, their General Manager worked at a snails pace and dropped the ball on our event by taking 3 weeks to review changes to the contract. He then decided "he had a feeling" and did not want to move forward with our wedding. All after wasting 2 months of our time, bravo -

The Mayflower is unreasonable (they wanted to charge us $16 per drink at the wedding), unprofessional and didn't even return phone calls to explain the above. They are a dinosaur venue (albeit with a pretty garden and nice spa), food is mediocre at best and rooms are beyond expensive for the price ($550 per night?). You are better off going to The Homestead Inn for a true luxury weekend. Avoid at all costs!
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!
No Cell Phone Reception. Period.
reviews.text: I'm not sure what all the complaining is about.... My husband sent me there as an anniversary/birthday gift. Although it was a surprise, Mayflower contacted me before my husband told me and ruined it. : ( They did, however, say sorry and sent me a nice letter to my room and a dish of chocolate covered strawberries... All was forgiven (thank you Jamie)!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was 3 days and 2 nights of pure bliss. Check in is at 3 but you can get there as early as you like and spend the day at the spa or pool just relaxing. I got there at 11:00 and they came and found me at 1:00 to tell me my room was done early and I could check in. Everyone knows you by name and addresses you by Mr. or Mrs. _______ when they see you. The attention is first rate!
reviews.title: New England Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, so the rooms "look" a little dated but that is done on purpose. Everything is new and the bathrooms are beautiful. Yes, the walls are thin and you can here sounds of people walking around or talking (muffled). It's not that big of a deal. No cell phone or blackberry service, but I didn't care. I went there to get away from the world. They have laptops in the buildings for you to use if you need to. Okay, the staff is a bit young and don't really know what's going on. They don't know the answers to most questions and you also get different answers to the questions you ask depending on the person you talk with.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service and Food, Beautiful Property

description: The Mayflower Inn, located less than 2 hours from New York City, evokes the elegance of an English countryside hotel. Set on 28 acres of rolling hills, streams and gardens, each of the 30 guest rooms are individually decorated to offer a unique experience. The restaurant offers a memorable fine dining experience from either the tap or dining room menus, and the inn’s expansive wine list features many fine selections from the Mayflower wine cellar.
